repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: "99 searchcount ought to be enough for anyone."

Solution: Increase `SEARCH_STAT_DEF_MAX_COUNT` to 999, which I'm sure
will suffice for the next twenty years.

Closes #33748.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  " Create a new undo block so we can revert the change later.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -75,53 +75,61 @@ func Test_search_stat()
   call assert_notmatch(pat .. stat, g:a)
   " n does not update search stat
   call assert_equal(
-    \ #{current: 50, exact_match: 1, total: 50, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 99},
+    \ #{current: 50, exact_match: 1, total: 50, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
     \ searchcount(#{recompute: 0}))
   call assert_equal(
-    \ #{current: 2, exact_match: 1, total: 50, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 99},
+    \ #{current: 2, exact_match: 1, total: 50, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
     \ searchcount(#{recompute: v:true}))
   set shortmess-=S
 
+  " Nvim: max search count is 999; append more lines to surpass it.
+  " Create an new undo block so we can revert the change later.

     \ searchcount(#{recompute: v:true}))

comment_regular_data.body: I'll probably need help adjusting the `search_stat` tests that check for `>99`.

```
command line..script /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/test/old/testdir/runtest.vim[593]..function RunTheTest[57]..Test_search_stat line 90: Pattern '.\\s\\+\\[>999/>999\\]' does not match '\n/.\[  occurs 76 times]\n\n/.\[  occurs 70 times][?/??]'
```

Lol, looks like the ASAN job is so slow that it times out on the search :innocent:

I also tried to make the old tests work, but gave up when I got to the last couple test cases.

I don't know what policy you guys have about updating(not fixing but improving upon) the old tests, so I apologize if it is out of place

Do you guys think here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33937/files#diff-69c48a405c43c1fd0c8d7b51be1810692e2933f9fd7a1be377cbca5d7613d862R9

Instead of creating a 50 line dummy text file, maybe increasing it to, say 500, would be better?
I think it is inline with the change we're making: since we are increasing the max count, increase the test file


Here's what I mean more or less(from my local draft branch)

```diff 
diff --git i/test/old/testdir/test_search_stat.vim w/test/old/testdir/test_search_stat.vim
index 7c8ce2345f..da1b183cee 100644
--- i/test/old/testdir/test_search_stat.vim
+++ w/test/old/testdir/test_search_stat.vim
@@ -1,49 +1,49 @@
 " Tests for search_stats, when "S" is not in 'shortmess'
 
 source check.vim
 source screendump.vim
 
 func Test_search_stat()
   new
   set shortmess-=S
-  " Append 50 lines with text to search for, "foobar" appears 20 times
-  call append(0, repeat(['foobar', 'foo', 'fooooobar', 'foba', 'foobar'], 10))
+  " Append 500 lines with text to search for, "foobar" appears 20 times
+  call append(0, repeat(['foobar', 'foo', 'fooooobar', 'foba', 'foobar'], 100))
 
   call cursor(1, 1)
 
   " searchcount() returns an empty dictionary when previous pattern was not set
   call assert_equal({}, searchcount(#{pattern: ''}))
   " but setting @/ should also work (even 'n' nor 'N' was executed)
   " recompute the count when the last position is different.
   call assert_equal(
-    \ #{current: 1, exact_match: 1, total: 40, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
+    \ #{current: 1, exact_match: 1, total: 400, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
     \ searchcount(#{pattern: 'foo'}))
   call assert_equal(
-    \ #{current: 0, exact_match: 0, total: 10, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
+    \ #{current: 0, exact_match: 0, total: 100, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
     \ searchcount(#{pattern: 'fooooobar'}))
   call assert_equal(
-    \ #{current: 0, exact_match: 0, total: 10, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
+    \ #{current: 0, exact_match: 0, total: 100, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
     \ searchcount(#{pattern: 'fooooobar', pos: [2, 1, 0]}))
   call assert_equal(
-    \ #{current: 1, exact_match: 1, total: 10, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
+    \ #{current: 1, exact_match: 1, total: 100, incomplete: 0, maxcount: 999},
     \ searchcount(#{pattern: 'fooooobar', pos: [3, 1, 0]}))
     
...

```
PSA: This PR is ready and just waiting for more input _from core maintainers_ about whether the divergence from Vim is worth it. I'll squash and merge it once we have consensus.

@swivelmargarita Tests are already passing. That test was adjusted [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/2f73c564dcce57ca3e1de66aca27816566952fdd#diff-69c48a405c43c1fd0c8d7b51be1810692e2933f9fd7a1be377cbca5d7613d862R85).

The current CI failure is due to the fixup commit not being squashed yet while we wait for other reviews.

Sorry for polluting the PR with messages, I completely overlooked that part.

Thanks @seandewar

repo.name: neovim

title: feat(search): increase `MAX_COUNT` to 999
